required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multi-center, Survival Data Collection in Subjects Previously Enrolled in Celgene Protocol CC-5013-MDS-003
clinical_study.official_title: Multi-center, Survival Data Collection in Subjects Previously Enrolled in Celgene Protocol CC-5013-MDS-003

brief_summary.textblock: Multi-center, survival data collection in subjects previously enrolled in study NCT00065156 (Celgene Protocol CC-5013-MDS-003).

primary_outcome.measure: Participants Survival Status as of the Time of the Extension Study Follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Count of participants who were alive or deceased at the time of the extension study follow-up.

primary_outcome.measure: Kaplan Meier Estimate for Overall Survival
primary_outcome.description: Overall survival was measured from the start of therapy in CC-5013-MDS-003 to the date of death from any cause. Results include data collected during the extension follow-up.

primary_outcome.measure: Participants Status Regarding Progression to Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) as of the Time of the Extension Study Follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Count of participants who progressed to AML at the time of the extension study follow-up.

primary_outcome.measure: Kaplan Meier Estimate for Progression to Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML)
primary_outcome.description: Progression to AML was measured from the start of therapy in CC-5013-MDS-003 to the date AML was diagnosed. Results include data collected during the extension follow-up.

primary_outcome.measure: Cause of Death for Participants Who Died
primary_outcome.description: Summary of the cause of death for participants from MDS-003 who died as of the time of the extension study follow-up.

arm_group.description: No intervention was given during this extension study which gathered survival information on participants of study NCT00065156 (Celgene study CC-5013-MDS-003). During the CC-5013-MDS-003 study, participants initially took a syncopated dosage regimen in which 10 mg of lenalidomide was taken orally once daily on Days 1 to 21 of a 28-day cycle. The study was amended to employ a continuous dosage regimen in which 10 mg of lenalidomide was taken without a planned rest period. Participants who initially began therapy on the syncopated regimen and who did not experience dose-limiting adverse events (AEs) were allowed to switch to the continuous regimen.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects Previously Enrolled in Celgene Protocol NCT00065156 (CC-5013-MDS-003)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Must have been enrolled in the Celgene protocol CC-5013-MDS-003 study.
2. Must understand and be able to give informed consent (if a subject is deceased, proper legal consent (i.e. next of kin, legal representative) will be obtained prior to collection of data).
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Consent refused for any reason at current or long-term follow up completed in 2007 (long-term follow up: survival data collection completed to obtain further safety information on CC-5013-MDS-003 discontinued subjects from May - October 2007).

results_reference.citation: List A, Dewald G, Bennett J, Giagounidis A, Raza A, Feldman E, Powell B, Greenberg P, Thomas D, Stone R, Reeder C, Wride K, Patin J, Schmidt M, Zeldis J, Knight R; Myelodysplastic Syndrome-003 Study Investigators. Lenalidomide in the myelodysplastic syndrome with chromosome 5q deletion. N Engl J Med. 2006 Oct 5;355(14):1456-65.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This extension study was conducted specifically to provide further long-term outcomes as regards overall survival/vital status and the possible occurrence of progression to AML for all participants previously enrolled in study NCT00065156 (Celgene CC-5013-MDS-003). Participants from the original study are included in the Participant Flow.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: When the final MDS-003 clinical study report was written, 76 participants had died; therefore, 72 of all 148 participants who first enrolled in the MDS-003 study could have been included in the extension study. Sixteen did not participate because their investigative sites did not participant. Two withdrew consent during the earlier study.

group.title: Lenalidomide
group.description: No intervention was given during this extension study which gathered survival information on participants of study NCT00065156 (Celgene study CC-5013-MDS-003). During the CC-5013-MDS-003 study, participants initially took a syncopated dosage regimen in which 10 mg of lenalidomide was taken orally once daily on Days 1 to 21 of a 28-day cycle. The study was amended to employ a continuous dosage regimen in which 10 mg of lenalidomide was taken without a planned rest period. Participants who initially began therapy on the syncopated regimen and who did not experience dose-limiting adverse events (AEs) were allowed to switch to the continuous regimen.

participants_list.participants: This information duplicates results in NCT00065156.
Participants from MDS-003 (including some who did not complete) at sites participating in MDS-009.

milestone.title: Other Source of Follow-up Info Used

participants_list.participants: Social Security Death Index, public records, verbal reports from health providers and next of kin.

outcome.description: Count of participants who progressed to AML at the time of the extension study follow-up.
outcome.population: Intent to treat population. One participant was diagnosed by central reviewer as having AML at entry to the MDS-003 study (baseline) so was excluded from this analysis.

measurement_list.measurement: Not evaluable as 50% of participants in MDS-003 did not progress to AML.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Unless approved by Celgene, single center data will not be published before multicenter data, unless more than 1 year has elapsed since completion of the Study. Thereafter, Investigator may publish single center data provided that Investigator shall: i) provide a copy of the publication to Celgene at least 60 days in advance of submission for publication; ii) delete Celgene Confidential Information and; iii) delay submission up to 90 additional days to permit intellectual property filings.
